dns.description: This setting defines the maximum number of entries that may be stored in the DNS cache before the oldest entry is evicted.
When enabled, the TTL of each entry will be overridden with the value defined in resolve.ttl.override.
Number of seconds to override the TTL with. When set to 0, the TTL will expire directly
This setting enables the local DNS override table. When enabled, Gosub will return any IP address that is defined in the local DNS override table.
This setting defines the local DNS override table.
This setting enabled DNS over HTTPS. A secure way of communicating with DNS servers.
This setting enabled DNS over TLS. A secure way of communicating with DNS servers.
Any resolvers defined here will be used for DNS lookups. If no resolvers are defined, the system resolvers will be used.
How many times to retry a DNS lookup before giving up.
How many seconds to wait for a DNS lookup to complete before giving up.
When enabled, Gosub will use the hosts file to resolve hostnames as well.

useragent.description: This setting sets the default page to load when GosuB starts or when a new tab is opened.
Defines where the close button on tabs located
Defines how many tabs may be opened inside a window. -1 means unlimited.

renderer.description: When set to true, the OpenGL renderer will be used. When set to false, the software renderer will be used.
